snippet: As the Western European auto market enters a slump, the burden of reducing its costly production surplus is likely to fall disproportionately on certain communities.
abstract: Western European auto market enters a slump, and the burden of reducing its costly production surplus is likely to fall disproportionately on manufacturing communities like Bochum, Germany; General Motors, after losing $747 million on its European operations in 2011, is under intense pressure to make further cuts at its Opel division; plant in Bochum is considered the most endangered.
lead_paragraph: As the Western European auto market enters a slump, the burden of reducing its costly production surplus is likely to fall disproportionately on certain communities.

headline.seo: Opel’s Future Weighs Heavily on German Town
headline.main: Opel’s Future Weighs Heavily on German Town
headline.print_headline: The Future of Opel, Already Downsized, Weighs Heavily on a German City
